result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fernando Maldonado

1:32 PM . Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Fernando Maldonado in court. Court Reporter: Donna Moore. 
Defendant makes statement regarding not having counsel. 
State indicates victim would like to lift no contact order. 
Victim makes statements on the record. 
States does not object to modify the no contact order to no violent contact
States makes a global offer on the record. 
Defendant needs more time to secure counsel.
BTC: Matter rescheduled. 
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim K.A(person, property, residence or family).

AMENDED 5/20/22- May have no violent contact with victim
